com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface changeOrderSchedule

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface changeOrderSchedule

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document changeOrderSchedule(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The changeOrderSchedule API changes the schedule attributes of an order.

    • Method Detail

      • changeOrderSchedule

        org.w3c.dom.Document changeOrderSchedule(YFSEnvironment env,
                                         org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                  throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                         java.rmi.RemoteException
        The changeOrderSchedule API changes the schedule attributes of an order.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        Additional Information
        Calculating the Expected dates in the ToSchedule

        • If the ToExpectedShipDate is passed but not the ToExpectedDeliveryDate, the ToExpectedDeliveryDate is calculated as follows :
            ToExpectedDeliveryDate = ToExpectedShipDate + ( difference between ExpectedDeliveryDate and ExpectedShipDate in the earlier schedule).
        • If both ToExpectedShipDate date and ToExpectedDeliveryDate date are passed, they are used as is.
        • If ToExpectedDeliveryDate date is passed but not ToExpectedShipDate then:
            ToExpectedShipDate = ToExpectedDeliveryDate - ( difference between ExpectedDeliveryDate and ExpectedShipDate in the earlier schedule).
        • If neither ToExpectedShipDate nor ToExpectedDeliveryDate date is passed, neither value is modified.

        Status validations
        Status level validation is done using order modification rules for modification type CHANGE_SCHEDULE. If release information is passed as well as the line information then the validation is done for the ORDER_RELEASE_LINE level. If only line information is passed then the validation is done at ORDER_LINE level.

        User Exits:


          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetTagNoUE

        Events Raised:
        ON_SCHEDULE_CHANGE:

          Data published - YFS_CHANGE_ORDER_SCHEDULE.ON_SCHEDULE_CHANGE.xml - The input xml is also appended to the root node of the output xml.
          Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt

        Template Support:
        Yes. Some of the elements and attributes are not template driven. Refer to xml for element level details.
        ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE:
          Data published - YFS_ORDER_CHANGE.ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE.xml
          Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt

        Template Support:
        Yes.

        Raised under the transaction INVENTORY_CHANGE

          INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_DEMAND_CHANGE:
            Raised when there is a demand update.
            Key Data: INVENTORY_CHANGE_EXTERNAL_DEMAND_CHANGE_dbd.txt
            Data Published: INV_INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_DEMAND_CHANGE.html
            Template Support: Yes
          INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_SUPPLY_CHANGE:
            Raised when there is a supply update.
            Key Data: INVENTORY_CHANGE_EXTERNAL_SUPPLY_CHANGE_dbd.txt
            Data Published: INV_INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_SUPPLY_CHANGE.html
            Template Support: Yes

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support:
        Yes. Some of the elements and attributes are not template driven. Refer to output xml for element level details.

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document. The input xml is appended to the root node of the output xml. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
